availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse H. Reno (Muhlenberg Circuit Court clerk and quartermaster, 11th KY Infantry)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, circuit clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis Reno, Sr., and Sarah Kincheloe. Married to Frances W. Young Reno in 1842. Married to Harriet M. Elliott Reno in 1846. Father of Jane Reno, Agnes Reno, Jesse Reno, and Edward E. Reno. Clerk of the Muhlenberg Circuit Court in Muhlenberg County from 1859 to 1866. Quartermaster of the 11th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from 1861 to March 17, 1862. Married to Mary Elizabeth Payne Reno in 1868.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 40.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #998, p. unknown. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #998, p. 1. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #1000, p. 1.
National Park Service, U.S. Civil War Soldiers, 1861-1865 "Jesse H. Reno," Film #M386, roll 22 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
